DOCUMENT
SECTION
  • ARTICLE
    CONTENTSUBTITLETITLE
    <div class="crrArticle">This Regulation specifies the single electronic reporting format, as referred to in Article 4(7) of Directive 2004/109/EC, to be used for the preparation of annual financial reports by issuers.</div>Subject matterArticle 1
    <div class="crrArticle"> <p>For the purposes of this Regulation, the following definitions shall apply:</p> <ol class="crrNumList"> <li>core taxonomy means the combined set of the taxonomy elements set out in Annex VI and the following collection of links:</li> <ol class="crrCharList"> <li>presentation linkbase, which groups the taxonomy elements;</li> <li>calculation linkbase, which expresses arithmetic relationships between taxonomy elements;</li> <li>label linkbase, which describes the meaning of each taxonomy element;</li> <li>definition linkbase, which reflects dimensional relationships of the core taxonomy elements;</li> </ol> <li>extension taxonomy means the combined set of taxonomy elements and the following collection of links, both created by the issuer:</li> <ol class="crrCharList"> <li>presentation linkbase, which groups the taxonomy elements;</li> <li>calculation linkbase, which expresses arithmetic relationships between taxonomy elements;</li> <li>label linkbase, which describes the meaning of each taxonomy element;</li> <li>definition linkbase, which ensures dimensional validity of the resulting XBRL instance document against the extension taxonomy;</li> </ol> <li>IFRS consolidated financial statements means consolidated financial statements prepared in accordance with either IFRS adopted pursuant to Regulation (EC) No 1606/2002 or with IFRS as referred to in point (a) of the first subparagraph of Article 1 of Decision 2008/961/EC.</li> </ol> </div>DefinitionsArticle 2
    <div class="crrArticle">Issuers shall prepare their entire annual financial reports in XHTML format.</div>Single electronic reporting formatArticle 3
    <ol class="crrNumList"> <li>Where annual financial reports include IFRS consolidated financial statements, issuers shall mark up those consolidated financial statements.</li> <li>Issuers shall, as a minimum, mark up the disclosures specified in Annex II where those disclosures are present in those IFRS consolidated financial statements.</li> <li>Issuers may mark up disclosures presented in IFRS consolidated financial statements other than those set out in paragraph 2.</li> <li>For markups set out in paragraphs 1, 2 and 3, issuers shall use the XBRL markup language and shall use a taxonomy in which the elements shall be those set out in the core taxonomy. Where, in accordance with point 4 of Annex IV, it is not appropriate to use elements in the core taxonomy, issuers shall create extension taxonomy elements as provided for in Annex IV.</li> </ol>Marking up IFRS consolidated financial statementsArticle 4
    <ol class="crrNumList"> <li>Issuers incorporated in Member States may mark up all parts of their annual financial reports other than those set out in Article 4 if they use the XBRL markup language and a taxonomy specific to those parts and that taxonomy is provided by the Member State in which they are incorporated.</li> <li>Issuers incorporated in third countries shall not mark up any parts of their annual financial reports other than IFRS consolidated financial statements.</li> </ol>Marking up other parts of the annual financial reportsArticle 5
    <div class="crrArticle"> <p>For markups made in accordance with Articles 4 and 5, issuers shall comply with the following:</p> <ol class="crrCharList"> <li>embedding of markups in the issuersâ€™ annual financial reports in XHTML format using the Inline XBRL specifications set out in Annex III;</li> <li>requirements on marking up and filing rules set out in Annex IV.</li> </ol> </div>Common rules on markupsArticle 6
    <div class="crrArticle">ESMA may publish machine-readable and downloadable XBRL taxonomy files based on the core taxonomy. Those files shall comply with the criteria set out in Annex V.</div>XBRL taxonomy filesArticle 7
    <div class="crrArticle">This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union.<br>It shall apply to annual financial reports containing financial statements for financial years beginning on or after 1 January 2020.</div>Entry into force and applicationArticle 8
  • ARTICLE
    CONTENTSUBTITLETITLE
    <p class="title-gr-seq-level-1"><span class="italics">Legend for Tables 1 and 2 of Annex II, and for the Tables of Annexes IV and VI</span></p> <div style="margin-bottom:10px;"><table> <caption><caption></caption></caption> <tr> <th >DATA/ATTRIBUTE TYPE/PREFIX</th> <th >DEFINITION</th> </tr> <tr> <td >text block</td> <td >denotes that the element type is a block of text; it is used to mark up larger pieces of information, such as notes, accounting policies or tables; text blocks are non-numeric line items</td> </tr> <tr> <td >text</td> <td >denotes that the element type is text (a sequence of alphanumeric characters); it is used to mark up short pieces of narrative information; text elements are non-numeric line items</td> </tr> <tr> <td >yyyy-mm-dd</td> <td >denotes that the element type is a date; these elements are line items and non-numeric</td> </tr> <tr> <td >X</td> <td >denotes that the element type is monetary (a number in a declared currency); these elements are numeric line items</td> </tr> <tr> <td >X.XX</td> <td >denotes that the element type is a decimalised value (such as a percentage or a <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0004" REF.END="QE0004"></QUOT.START>per share<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0004" REF.START="QS0004"></QUOT.END> value); these elements are numeric line items</td> </tr> <tr> <td >shares</td> <td >denotes that the element type is a number of shares; these elements are numeric line items</td> </tr> <tr> <td >table</td> <td >denotes the beginning of a structure represented by a table where rows and columns contribute to definition of an financial concept on their intersection</td> </tr> <tr> <td >axis</td> <td >denotes a dimensional property in a tabular structure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >member</td> <td >denotes a member of a dimension on an axis</td> </tr> <tr> <td >guidance</td> <td >denotes an element that supports browsing of taxonomy content</td> </tr> <tr> <td >role</td> <td >denotes an element representing a section of a taxonomy, e.g. statement of financial position, income statement, each individual note, etc.</td> </tr> <tr> <td >abstract</td> <td >denotes a grouping element or a header</td> </tr> <tr> <td >instant or duration</td> <td >denotes that the monetary value represents a stock (if instant) or a flow (if duration)</td> </tr> <tr> <td >credit or debit</td> <td >denotes the <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0005" REF.END="QE0005"></QUOT.START>natural<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0005" REF.START="QS0005"></QUOT.END> balance of the disclosure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >esef_cor</td> <td >prefix applied in the Tables of Annex IV and VI for elements defined in the namespace <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0006" REF.END="QE0006"></QUOT.START>http://www.esma.europa.eu/taxonomy/2019-03-27/esef_cor<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0006" REF.START="QS0006"></QUOT.END> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >esef_all</td> <td >prefix applied in the Table of Annex VI for elements defined in the namespace <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0007" REF.END="QE0007"></QUOT.START>http://www.esma.europa.eu/taxonomy/2019-03-27/esef_all<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0007" REF.START="QS0007"></QUOT.END> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >esma_technical</td> <td >prefix applied in the Table of Annex VI for elements defined in the namespace <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0008" REF.END="QE0008"></QUOT.START>http://www.esma.europa.eu/taxonomy/ext/technical<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0008" REF.START="QS0008"></QUOT.END> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >prefix applied in the Tables of Annexes IV and VI for elements defined in the namespace <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0009" REF.END="QE0009"></QUOT.START>http://xbrl.ifrs.org/taxonomy/2019-03-27/ifrs-full<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0009" REF.START="QS0009"></QUOT.END> </td> </tr> </table></div>Legend for Tables 1 and 2 of Annex II, and for the Tables of Annexes IV and VIANNEX I
    <p class="title-gr-seq-level-1"><span class="italics">Mandatory markups</span></p> <ol class="crrNumList"> <li>Issuers shall mark up all numbers in a declared currency disclosed in the statement of financial position, the statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, the statement of changes in equity and the statement of cash flows in IFRS consolidated financial statements.</li> <li>Issuers shall mark up all disclosures made in IFRS consolidated financial statements or made by cross-reference therein to other parts of the annual financial reports for financial years beginning on or after 1 January 2020 that correspond to the elements in Table 1 of this Annex.</li> <li>Issuers shall mark up all disclosures made in IFRS consolidated financial statements or made by cross-reference therein to other parts of the annual financial reports for financial years beginning on or after 1 January 2022 that correspond to the elements in Table 2 of this Annex.<p><div style="margin-bottom:10px;"><table> <caption>Table 1<caption>Mandatory elements of the core taxonomy to be marked up for financial years beginning on or after 1 January 2020</caption> </caption> <tr> <th >Label</th> <th >Data type and other attributes</th> <th >References to IFRSs</th> </tr> <tr> <td >Name of reporting entity or other means of identification</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 51 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Explanation of change in name of reporting entity or other means of identification from end of preceding reporting period</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 51 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Domicile of entity</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Legal form of entity</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Country of incorporation</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Address of entity's registered office</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Principal place of business</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Description of nature of entity's operations and principal activities</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Name of parent entity</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 c, IAS 24 13</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Name of ultimate parent of group</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 24 13, IAS 1 138 c</td> </tr> </table></div></p> <p><div style="margin-bottom:10px;"><table> <caption>Table 2<caption>Mandatory elements of the core taxonomy to be marked up for financial years beginning on or after 1 January 2022</caption> </caption> <tr> >Explanation of change in name of reporting entity or other means of identification from end of preceding reporting period</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 51 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Domicile of entity</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Legal form of entity</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 138 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Country of incorporation</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 1 138 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Statement of IFRS compliance [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 16</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Explanation of departure from IFRS</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 20 b, IAS 1 20 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Explanation of financial effect of departure from IFRS</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 20 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of uncertainties of entity's ability to continue as going concern [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 25</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Explanation of fact and basis for preparation of financial statements when not going concern basis</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 25</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Explanation of why entity not regarded as going concern</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 25</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Description of reason for using longer or shorter reporting period</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 36 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Description of fact that amounts presented in financial statements are not entirely comparable</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 36 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of reclassifications or changes in presentation [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 41</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Explanation of sources of estimation uncertainty with significant risk of causing material adjustment</td> <td >text</td> <td >IAS 1 125, IFRIC 14 10</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of assets and liabilities with duration</td> <td >IAS 1 107</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Dividends proposed or declared before financial statements authorised for issue but not recognised as distribution to owners</td> <td >X duration</td> <td >IAS 1 137 a, IAS 10 13</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Dividends proposed or declared before financial statements authorised for issue but not recognised as distribution to owners per share</td> <td >X.XX duration</td> <td >IAS 1 137 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of accounting judgements and estimates [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of accrued <td >Disclosure of insurance contracts [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IFRS 17 Disclosure - Effective <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE>, IFRS 4 Disclosure - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of insurance premium revenue [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of intangible assets and goodwill [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of intangible assets [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 38 Disclosure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of interest expense [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of interest income (expense) [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of interest income [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of interests in other entities [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IFRS 12 1</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of interim financial reporting [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 34 Content of an interim financial report</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of inventories [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 2 Disclosure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of investment contracts liabilities [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of investment property [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 40 Disclosure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of investments accounted for using equity method [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of investments other than investments accounted for using equity method [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of issued capital [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of joint ventures [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 27 17 b, IAS 27 16 b, IFRS 12 B4 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of lease prepayments [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of leases [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IFRS 16 Presentation, IFRS 16 Disclosure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of liquidity risk [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of loans and advances to banks [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 10 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of loans and advances to customers block</td> <td >IAS 1 117 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >Disclosure of significant accounting policies [text block]</td> <td >text block</td> <td >IAS 1 117</td> </tr> </table></div></p> </li> </ol>Mandatory markupsANNEX II
    <p class="title-gr-seq-level-1"><span class="italics">Applicable Inline XBRL specifications</span></p> <ol class="crrNumList"> <li>Issuers shall ensure that the Inline XBRL instance document is valid with respect to the Inline XBRL 1.1 specification and is conform to the XBRL Units Registry.</li> <li>Issuers shall ensure that the issuerâ€™s XBRL extension taxonomy files are valid with respect to the XBRL 2.1 and the XBRL Dimensions 1.0 specifications.</li> <li>Issuers shall submit the Inline XBRL instance document and the issuerâ€™s XBRL extension taxonomy files as a single reporting package where XBRL taxonomy files are packaged according to the Taxonomy Packages specifications.</li> <li>Issuers shall ensure that both the Inline XBRL instance document and the issuerâ€™s extension taxonomy respect the requirements of the marking up and filing rules set out in Annex IV.</li> </ol>Applicable Inline XBRL specificationsANNEX III
    <p class="title-gr-seq-level-1"><span class="italics">Marking up and filing rules</span></p> <ol class="crrNumList"> <li>Issuers shall ensure that the Inline XBRL instance document contains data of a single issuer, so that all entity identifiers in contexts shall have identical content.</li> <li>Issuers shall identify themselves in the Inline XBRL instance document using ISO 17442 legal entity identifiers on the XBRL context entity identifiers and schemes.</li> <li>When marking up disclosures, issuers shall use the core taxonomy element with the closest accounting meaning to the disclosure being marked up. Where there appears to be a choice of core taxonomy elements, issuers should select the element with the narrowest accounting meaning and/or scope.</li> <li>If the closest core taxonomy element would misrepresent the accounting meaning of the disclosure being marked up as required by point 3, issuers shall create an extension taxonomy element and use that to mark up the disclosure concerned. All extension taxonomy elements created shall:<p><ol class="crrCharList"> <li>not duplicate the meaning and scope of any core taxonomy element;</li> <li>identify the creator of the element;</li> <li>be assigned with an appropriate balance attribute;</li> <li>have standard labels in the language corresponding to the language of the annual financial report. Labels in additional languages are recommended to be added. All labels shall correspond to the accounting meaning and scope of the described underlying business concepts.</li> </ol></p> </li> <li>Issuers shall ensure that each extension taxonomy element used to mark up a disclosure in the annual financial report is included in at least one hierarchy of the presentation linkbase and of the definition linkbase of the extension taxonomy.</li> <li>Issuers shall use the calculation linkbases of their extension taxonomies to document arithmetical relationships between numeric core and/or extension taxonomy elements, in particular for arithmetic relationships between core and/or extension taxonomy elements from the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity and statement of cash flows.</li> <li>To identify to which part of the financial statements the markups relate, issuers shall use dedicated root taxonomy elements as starting points for the respective parts of the financial statements in their extension taxonomyâ€™s presentation linkbases. The element names, labels and prefixes of these root taxonomy elements shall be as set out in the Table 1.<p><div style="margin-bottom:10px;"><table> <caption>Table<caption>Element names, labels and prefixes of the root elements</caption> </caption> <tr> <th >Prefix</th> <th >Element name</th> <th >Label</th> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td > <p>StatementOfFinancial</p> <p>PositionAbstract</p> </td> <td >Statement of financial position placeholder - this item MUST be used as a starting point for the statement of financial position</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td > <p>IncomeStatement</p> <p>Abstract</p> </td> <td >Profit or loss placeholder - this item MUST be used as a starting point for the statement of profit or loss if the statement of profit or loss is disclosed separately</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td > <p>StatementOfCompre</p> <p>hensiveIncomeAbstract</p> </td> <td >Statement of comprehensive income placeholder - this item MUST be used as a starting point for the statement of comprehensive income if it is disclosed separately or when the statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income statements are combined in a single statement</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td > <p>StatementOfCash</p> <p>FlowsAbstract</p> </td> <td >Statement of cash flows placeholder - this item MUST be used as a starting point for the statement of cash flows</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td > <p>StatementOfChangesIn</p> <p>EquityAbstract</p> </td> <td >Statement of changes in equity placeholder - this item MUST be used as a starting point for the statement of changes in equity</td> </tr> <tr> <td >esef_cor</td> <td > <p>NotesAccountingPolicies</p> <p>AndMandatoryTags</p> </td> <td >Notes, accounting policies and mandatory core taxonomy elements placeholder â€“ this item MUST be used as a starting point for markups of disclosures in the notes to the financial statements</td> </tr> </table></div></p> <p>The dedicated root taxonomy elements shall also be included in the XBRL taxonomy files prepared by ESMA.</p> </li> <li>In their extension taxonomies, issuers shall not replace the labels or references of core taxonomy elements. Issuer specific labels may be added to the core taxonomy elements.</li> <li>Issuers shall ensure that the issuerâ€™s extension taxonomy elements marking up the IFRS consolidated financial statementsâ€™ statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity and statement of cash flows are anchored to one or more core taxonomy elements. In particular:<p><ol class="crrCharList"> <li>the issuer shall anchor its extension taxonomy element to the core taxonomy element having the closest wider accounting meaning and/or scope to that extension taxonomy element of the issuer. The issuer shall identify the relationship of the extension taxonomy element concerned with the core taxonomy element concerned in the issuerâ€™s extension taxonomyâ€™s definition linkbase. The extension taxonomy element shall appear as the target of the relationship;</li> <li>the issuer may anchor the extension taxonomy element to the core taxonomy element or elements having the closest narrower accounting meaning and/or scope to that extension taxonomy element concerned. The issuer shall identify the relationship of the extension taxonomy element concerned with the core taxonomy element or elements concerned in the issuerâ€™s extension taxonomyâ€™s definition linkbase. The extension taxonomy element shall appear as the source of the relationship or relationships. Where the extension taxonomy element combines a number of core taxonomy elements, the issuer shall anchor that extension taxonomy element to each of those core taxonomy elements except any such core taxonomy element or elements, which are reasonably deemed to be insignificant.</li> </ol></p> </li> <li>Notwithstanding point 9, issuers do not need to anchor to another core taxonomy element an extension taxonomy element that is used to mark up a disclosure in the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity or the statement of cash flows that is a subtotal of other disclosures in the same statement.</li> <li>Issuers shall ensure that the data type and period type of a taxonomy element used to mark up a disclosure reflects the accounting meaning of the marked up disclosure. Issuers shall not define and apply a custom type for a taxonomy element, if a suitable type is already defined by the XBRL specifications or in the XBRL Data Types Registry.</li> <li>When marking up disclosures, issuers shall not use numeric taxonomy elements to mark up different values for a given context (entity, period and dimensional breakdowns) unless the difference is a result of rounding related to presentation of the same information with different scale in more than one place in the same annual financial report.</li> <li>When marking up disclosures, issuers shall use non-numeric taxonomy elements in a way that it marks up all disclosures that match the definition of the respective element. Issuers shall not apply the markups only partially or selectively.</li> <li>Issuers shall ensure that the Inline XBRL instance document does not contain executable code.</li> </ol>Marking up and filing rulesANNEX IV
    <p class="title-gr-seq-level-1"><span class="italics">XBRL taxonomy files</span></p> <p>XBRL taxonomy files published by ESMA shall:</p> <ol class="crrCharList"> <li>identify, as XBRL elements, all core taxonomy elements;</li> <li>set attributes of core taxonomy elements following their type as prescribed in Annex I;</li> <li>provide the human readable labels, as set out in the Table of Annex VI, documenting the meaning of the core taxonomy elements as well as references;</li> <li>define structures facilitating browsing of taxonomy content and understanding of the definition of a core taxonomy element in the context of other core taxonomy elements;</li> <li>define relationships that allow issuers to anchor extension taxonomy elements to core taxonomy elements;</li> <li>be valid according to XBRL 2.1. specifications, XBRL Dimensions 1.0 specifications and be packaged according to the Taxonomy Packages specifications as set out in Annex III;</li> <li>contain the technical information necessary for developing IT solutions supporting the production of harmonised annual financial reports;</li> <li>identify to which periods they refer.</li> </ol>XBRL taxonomy filesANNEX V
    <p class="title-gr-seq-level-1"><span class="italics">Schema of the core taxonomy</span></p> <div style="margin-bottom:10px;"><table> <caption>Table<caption>Schema of the core taxonomy to mark up IFRS consolidated financial statements</caption> </caption> <tr> <th >Prefix</th> <th >Element name/role URI</th> <th >Element type and attributes</th> <th >Label</th> <th >Documentation label</th> <th >References</th> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AbnormallyLargeChangesInAssetPricesOrForeignExchangeRatesMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Abnormally large changes in asset prices or foreign exchange rates [member]</td> <td >This member stands for abnormally large changes in asset prices or foreign exchange rates.</td> <td >example: IAS 10 22 g</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccountingEstimatesAxis</td> <td >axis</td> <td >Accounting estimates [axis]</td> <td >The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 8 39</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccountingEstimatesMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Accounting estimates [member]</td> <td >This member stands for an asset, a liability or a periodic consumption of an asset, subject to adjustments that result from the assessment of the present status of, and expected future benefits and obligations associated with, assets and liabilities. It also represents the standard value for the <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0010" REF.END="QE0010"></QUOT.START>Accounting estimates<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0010" REF.START="QS0010"></QUOT.END> axis if no other member is used.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 8 39</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccountingProfit</td> <td >X duration, credit</td> <td >Accounting profit</td> <td >The amount of profit (loss) for a period before deducting tax expense. [Refer: Profit (loss)]</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 12 81 c ii, disclosure: IAS 12 81 c i</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >Accruals</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accruals</td> <td >The amount of liabilities to pay for goods or services that have been received or supplied but have not been paid, invoiced or formally agreed with the supplier, including amounts due to employees.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 78</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsAndDeferredIncome</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accruals and deferred income</td> <td >The amount of accruals and deferred income. [Refer: Accruals; Deferred income]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 78</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsAndDeferredIncomeAbstract</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td >Accruals and deferred income [abstract]</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td ><IE></IE></td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsAndDeferredIncomeClassifiedAsCurrent</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accruals and deferred income classified as current</td> <td >The amount of accruals and deferred income classified as current. [Refer: Accruals and deferred income]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 78</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsAndDeferredIncomeClassifiedAsCurrentAbstract</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td >Accruals and deferred income classified as current [abstract]</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td ><IE></IE></td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsAndDeferredIncomeClassifiedAsNoncurrent</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accruals and deferred income classified as non-current</td> <td >The amount of accruals and deferred income classified as non-current. [Refer: Accruals and deferred income]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 78</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsAndDeferredIncomeClassifiedAsNoncurrentAbstract</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td >Accruals and deferred income classified as non-current [abstract]</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td ><IE></IE></td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsClassifiedAsCurrent</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accruals classified as current</td> <td >The amount of accruals classified as current. [Refer: Accruals]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 78</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccrualsClassifiedAsNoncurrent</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accruals classified as non-current</td> <td >The amount of accruals classified as non-current. [Refer: Accruals]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 78</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccruedIncome</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Accrued income</td> <td >The amount of asset representing income that has been earned but is not yet received.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 112 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedChangesInFairValueOfFinancialAssetsAttributableToChangesInCreditRiskOfFinancialAssets</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Accumulated increase (decrease) in fair value of financial assets designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss, attributable to changes in credit risk of financial assets</td> <td >The accumulated increase (decrease) in the fair value of financial assets designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of the assets determined either: (a) as the amount of change in their fair value that is not attributable to changes in market conditions that gave rise to market risk; or (b) using an alternative method that the entity believes more faithfully represents the amount of change in its fair value that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of the asset. [Refer: Credit risk [member]; Market risk [member]; Increase (decrease) in fair value of financial assets designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss, attributable to changes in credit risk of financial assets]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 9 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedChangesInFairValueOfFinancialAssetsRelatedCreditDerivativesOrSimilarInstruments</td> <td >X instant</td> <td >Accumulated increase (decrease) in fair value of credit derivatives or similar instruments related to financial assets designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss</td> <td >The accumulated increase (decrease) in fair value of credit derivatives or similar instruments related to financial assets designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss. [Refer: Derivatives [member]; Increase (decrease) in fair value of financial assets designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss related credit derivatives or similar instruments; Financial assets]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 9 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedChangesInFairValueOfFinancialLiabilityAttributableToChangesInCreditRiskOfLiability</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accumulated increase (decrease) in fair value of financial liability, attributable to changes in credit risk of liability</td> <td >The accumulated increase (decrease) in the fair value of financial liabilities that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of the liabilities. [Refer: Credit risk [member]; Market risk [member]; Increase (decrease) in fair value of financial liability, attributable to changes in credit risk of liability]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 10 a, disclosure: IFRS 7 10A a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedChangesInFairValueOfLoanOrReceivableAttributableToChangesInCreditRiskOfFinancialAssets</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Accumulated increase (decrease) in fair value of loan or receivable, attributable to changes in credit risk of financial assets</td> <td >The accumulated increase (decrease) in the fair value of loans or receivables that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of the assets determined either: (a) as the amount of change in their fair value that is not attributable to changes in the market conditions that gave rise to the market risk; or (b) using an alternative method the entity believes more faithfully represents the amount of change in its fair value that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of the asset. [Refer: Market risk [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 9 c - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedChangesInFairValueOfLoansOrReceivablesRelatedCreditDerivativesOrSimilarInstruments</td> <td >X instant</td> <td >Accumulated increase (decrease) in fair value of credit derivatives or similar instruments related to loans or receivables</td> <td >The aggregate increase (decrease) in the fair value of credit derivatives or similar instruments related to loans or receivables. [Refer: Impairment loss; Depreciation and amortisation expense]</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 16 73 d, disclosure: IAS 16 75 b, disclosure: IAS 38 118 c, disclosure: IAS 40 79 c, disclosure: IAS 41 54 f</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedDepreciationAndAmortisationMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Accumulated depreciation and amortisation [member]</td> <td >This member stands for accumulated depreciation and amortisation. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 16 73 d, disclosure: IAS 16 75 b, common practice: IAS 38 118 c, common practice: IAS 40 79 c, common practice: IAS 41 54 f</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedFairValueHedgeAdjustmentOnHedgedItemIncludedInCarryingAmountAssets</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment on hedged item included in carrying amount, assets</td> <td >The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustment on a hedged item that is included in the carrying amount of the hedged item, recognised in the statement of financial position as an asset. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 24B a ii</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedFairValueHedgeAdjustmentOnHedgedItemIncludedInCarryingAmountLiabilities</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment on hedged item included in carrying amount, liabilities</td> <td >The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustment on a hedged item that is included in the carrying amount of the hedged item, recognised in the statement of financial position as a liability. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 24B a ii</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AccumulatedFairValueHedgeAdjustmentRemainingInStatementOfFinancialPositionForHedgedItemThatCeasedToBeAdjustedForHedgingGainsAndLossesAssets</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment remaining in statement of financial position for hedged item that ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses, assets</td> <td >The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustment remaining in the statement of financial position for a hedged item that is a financial asset measured at amortised cost and has ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses. [Refer: Defined benefit plans [member]; Defined benefit obligation, at present value; Actuarial assumptions [member]]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 19 144</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialAssumptionOfExpectedRatesOfSalaryIncreasesMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Actuarial assumption of expected rates of salary increases [member]</td> <td >This member stands for the expected rates of salary increases used as actuarial assumptions. [Refer: Actuarial assumptions [member]]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 19 145</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialAssumptionOfLifeExpectancyAfterRetirement2019</td> <td >DUR</td> <td >Actuarial assumption of life expectancy after retirement</td> <td >The life expectancy after retirement used as a significant actuarial assumption to determine the present value of a defined benefit obligation. [Refer: Actuarial assumptions [member]]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 19 145</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialAssumptionsAxis</td> <td >axis</td> <td >Actuarial assumptions [axis]</td> <td >The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 19 145</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialAssumptionsMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Actuarial assumptions [member]</td> <td >This member stands for all actuarial assumptions. Actuarial assumptions are the entityâ€™s unbiased and mutually compatible best estimates of the demographic and financial variables that will determine the ultimate cost of providing post-employment benefits. It also represents the standard value for the <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0011" REF.END="QE0011"></QUOT.START>Actuarial assumptions<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0011" REF.START="QS0011"></QUOT.END> axis if no other member is used.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 19 145</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromChangesInDemographicAssumptionsNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in demographic assumptions, net defined benefit liability (asset)</td> <td >The decrease (increase) in a net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in demographic assumptions that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Demographic assumptions deal with matters such as: (a) mortality; (b) rates of employee turnover, disability and early retirement; (c) the proportion of plan members with dependants who will be eligible for benefits; (d) the proportion of plan members who will select each form of payment option available under the plan terms; and (e) claim rates under medical plans. [Refer: Net defined benefit liability (asset)]</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 19 141 c ii</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromChangesInFinancialAssumptionsNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in financial assumptions, net defined benefit liability (asset)</td> <td >The decrease (increase) in a net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in financial assumptions that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Financial assumptions deal with items such as: (a) the discount rate; (b) benefit levels, excluding any cost of the benefits to be met by employees, and future salary; (c) in the case of medical benefits, future medical costs, including claim handling costs (ie the costs that will be incurred in processing and resolving claims, including legal and adjuster's fees); and (d) taxes payable by the plan on contributions relating to service before the reporting date or on benefits resulting from that service. [Refer: Net defined benefit liability (asset)]</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 19 141 c iii</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromExperienceAdjustmentsNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Actuarial gains (losses) arising from experience adjustments, net defined benefit liability (asset)</td> <td >The decrease (increase) in a net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from experience adjustments that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Experience adjustments deal with the effects of differences between the previous actuarial assumptions and what has actually occurred. [Refer: Net defined benefit liability (asset)]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 19 141 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ActuarialPresentValueOfPromisedRetirementBenefits</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Actuarial present value of promised retirement benefits</td> <td >The present value of the expected payments by a retirement benefit plan to existing and past employees, attributable to the service already rendered.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 26 35 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >AdditionalAllowanceRecognisedInProfitOrLossAllowanceAccountForCreditLossesOfFinancialAssets</td> <td >X duration</td> <td >Additional allowance recognised in profit or loss, allowance account for credit losses of financial assets</td> <td >The amount of additional allowance for credit losses of financial assets recognised in profit or loss. customers</td> <td >The amount of balances in customers' deposit accounts held by the entity that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.</td> <td >common practice: IAS customers' term deposits held by the entity.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 112 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >BalancesWithBanks</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Balances with banks</td> <td >The amount of cash balances held at banks.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 7 45</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >BankAcceptanceAssets</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Bank Transactions sometimes referred to as <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0025" REF.END="QE0025"></QUOT.START>true mergers<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0025" REF.START="QS0025"></QUOT.END> or <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0026" REF.END="QE0026"></QUOT.START>mergers of equals<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0026" REF.START="QS0026"></QUOT.END> are also business combinations as that term is used in IFRS 3.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 3 B64</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CancellationOfTreasuryShares</td> <td >X duration, credit</td> <td >Cancellation of treasury shares</td> <td >The amount of treasury stock cancelled during the period. [Refer: Treasury shares]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 106 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalCommitments</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Capital commitments</td> <td >The amount of future capital expenditures that the entity is committed to make.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 112 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalCommitmentsAbstract</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td >Capital commitments [abstract]</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td ><IE></IE></td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalisationRateMeasurementInputMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Capitalisation rate, measurement input [member]</td> <td >This member stands for a capitalisation rate used as a measurement input.</td> <td >example: IFRS 13 93 d, example: IFRS 13 IE63</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalisationRateOfBorrowingCostsEligibleForCapitalisation</td> <td >X.XX duration</td> <td >Capitalisation rate of borrowing costs eligible for capitalisation</td> <td >The weighted average of interest and other costs that an entity incurs in connection with the borrowing of funds applicable to the borrowings of the entity that are outstanding during the period, other than borrowings made specifically for the purpose of obtaining a qualifying asset. [Refer: Weighted average [member]; Borrowings]</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 23 26 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalisedDevelopmentExpenditureMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Capitalised development expenditure [member]</td> <td >This member stands for a class of intangible assets arising from development expenditure capitalised before the start of commercial production or use. An intangible asset shall only be recognised if the entity can demonstrate all of the following: (a) the technical feasibility of completing the intangible asset so that it will be available for use or sale; (b) its intention to complete the intangible asset and use or sell it; (c) its ability to use or sell the intangible asset; (d) how the intangible asset will generate probable future economic benefits. Among other things, the entity can demonstrate the existence of a market for the output of the intangible asset or the intangible asset itself or, if it is to be used internally, the usefulness of the intangible asset; (e) the availability of adequate technical, financial and other resources to complete the development and to use or sell the intangible asset; and (f) its ability to measure reliably the expenditure attributable to the intangible asset during its development.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 38 119</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalRedemptionReserve</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Capital redemption reserve</td> <td >A component of equity representing the reserve for the redemption of the entity's own shares.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 55</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalRedemptionReserveMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Capital redemption reserve [member]</td> <td >This member stands for a component of equity representing the reserve for the redemption of the entity's own shares.</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 108</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalRequirementsAxis</td> <td >axis</td> <td >Capital requirements [axis]</td> <td >The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 1 136</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CapitalRequirementsMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Capital requirements [member]</td> <td >This member stands for capital requirements that the entity is subject to. debit</td> <td >Cash receipts from futures contracts, forward contracts, option contracts and swap contracts, classified as investing activities</td> <td >The cash inflow from futures contracts, 7 16 h</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CashReceiptsFromRepaymentOfAdvancesAndLoansMadeToOtherPartiesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Cash receipts from repayment of advances and loans made to other parties, classified as investing activities</td> <td >The cash inflow from the repayment of advances and loans made to other parties (other than advances and loans of a financial institution), classified as investing activities.</td> <td >example: IAS 7 16 f</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CashReceiptsFromRepaymentOfAdvancesAndLoansMadeToRelatedParties</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Cash receipts from repayment of advances and loans made to related parties</td> <td >The cash inflow from repayment to the entity of loans and advances made to related parties. [Refer: Related parties [member]]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 7 16</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CashRepaymentsOfAdvancesAndLoansFromRelatedParties</td> <td >X duration, credit</td> <td >Cash repayments of advances and loans from related parties</td> <td >The cash outflow for repayments of advances and loans from related parties. [Refer: Related parties [member]; Advances received]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 7 17</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CashTransferred</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Cash transferred</td> <td >The fair value, at acquisition date, of cash transferred as consideration in a business combination. [Refer: Business combinations [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 3 B64 f i</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CategoriesOfAssetsRecognisedFromCostsToObtainOrFulfilContractsWithCustomersAxis</td> <td >axis</td> <td >Categories of assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers [axis]</td> <td >The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 15 128 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >CategoriesOfAssetsRecognisedFromCostsToObtainOrFulfilContractsWithCustomersMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Categories of assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers [member]</td> <td >This member stands for all categories of assets recognised from the costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers. It also represents the standard value for the <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0031" REF.END="QE0031"></QUOT.START>Classes of acquired receivables<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0031" REF.START="QS0031"></QUOT.END> axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Business combinations [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 3 B64 h</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ClassesOfAssetsAxis</td> <td >axis</td> <td >Classes of assets [axis]</td> <td >The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 36 126, disclosure: IAS 36 130 d ii, disclosure: IFRS 13 93, disclosure: IFRS 16 53</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ClassesOfAssetsMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Assets [member]</td> <td > <p>Expiry date 2020-01-01: This member stands for resources: (a) controlled by an entity as a result of past events; and (b) from which future economic benefits are expected to flow to the entity. It also represents the standard value for the Classes of assets axis if no other member is used.</p> <p>Effective 2020-01-01: This member stands for a present economic resource controlled by the entity as a result of past events. Economic resource is a right that has the potential to produce economic benefits. It also represents the standard value for the Classes of assets axis if no other member is used.</p> </td> <td >disclosure: IAS 36 126, disclosure: IFRS 13 93, disclosure: IFRS 16 53</td> </tr> <tr> A structured entity is an entity that has been designed so that voting or similar rights are not the dominant factor in deciding who controls the entity, such as when any voting rights relate to administrative tasks only and the relevant activities are directed by means of contractual arrangements. [Refer: Consolidated [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 12 Nature of the risks associated with an entity's interests in consolidated structured entities</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ConstantPrepaymentRateMeasurementInputMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Constant prepayment rate, measurement input [member]</td> <td >This member stands for the constant prepayment rate used as a measurement input.</td> <td >example: IFRS 13 93 d, example: IFRS 13 IE63</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ConstructionInProgress</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Construction in progress</td> <td >The amount of expenditure capitalised during the construction of non-current assets that are not yet available for use. [Refer: Business combinations [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 3 B64 g i</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ContingentLiabilitiesIncurredByVenturerInRelationToInterestsInJointVentures</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Contingent liabilities incurred in relation to interests in joint ventures</td> <td >The amount of contingent liabilities incurred in relation to interests in joint ventures. [Refer: Associates [member]; Contingent liabilities [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 12 23 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ContingentLiabilitiesMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Contingent liabilities [member]</td> <td >This member stands for possible obligations that arise from past events and whose existence will be confirmed only by the occurrence or non-occurrence of one or more uncertain future events not wholly within the control of the entity; or, present obligations that arise from past events but are not recognised because (a) it is probable that an outflow of resources embodying economic benefits will be required to settle the obligations; or (b) the amount of the obligations cannot be measured with sufficient reliability. It also represents the standard value for the <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0039" REF.END="QE0039"></QUOT.START>Classes of contingent liabilities<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0039" REF.START="QS0039"></QUOT.END> axis if no other member is used.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 37 88, disclosure: IFRS 3 B67 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ContingentLiabilitiesOfJointVentureMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Contingent liabilities related to joint ventures [member]</td> <td >This member stands for contingent liabilities that are related to joint ventures. Defined contribution plans are post-employment benefit plans under which an entity pays fixed contributions into a separate entity (a fund) and will have no legal or constructive obligation to pay further contributions if the fund does not hold sufficient assets to pay all employee benefits relating to employee service in the current and prior periods. It also represents the standard value for the <QUOT.START CODE="2018" ID="QS0046" REF.END="QE0046"></QUOT.START>Defined benefit plans<QUOT.END CODE="2019" ID="QE0046" REF.START="QS0046"></QUOT.END> axis if no other member is used.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 19 138</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DefinedBenefitPlansOtherThanMultiemployerPlansStatePlansAndPlansThatShareRisksBetweenEntitiesUnderCommonControlMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Defined benefit plans other than multi-employer plans, state plans and plans that share risks between entities under common control [member]</td> <td >This member stands for defined benefit plans other than multi-employer plans, state plans and plans that share risks between entities under common control. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 34 19</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DescriptionOfCompositionOfUnderlyingItemsForContractsWithDirectParticipationFeatures</td> <td >text</td> <td >Description of composition of underlying items for contracts with direct participation features</td> <td >The description of the composition of the underlying items for contracts with direct participation features. Insurance contracts with direct participation features are insurance contracts for which, at inception: (a) the contractual terms specify that the policyholder participates in a share of a clearly identified pool of underlying items; (b) the entity expects to pay to the policyholder an amount equal to a substantial share of the fair value returns on the underlying items; and (c) the entity expects a substantial proportion of any change in the amounts to be paid to the policyholder to vary with the change in fair value of the underlying items. Underlying items are items that determine some of the amounts payable to a policyholder.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 17 111 - Effective <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DescriptionOfConcentrationsOfInsuranceRisk</td> <td >text</td> <td >Description of concentrations of insurance risk</td> <td >The description of concentrations of insurance risk, including a description of how management determined concentrations and a description of the shared characteristic that identifies each concentration (for example, type of insured event, geographical area or currency).</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 4 39 c ii - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DescriptionOfConclusionWhyTransactionPriceWasNotBestEvidenceOfFairValue</td> <td >text</td> <td >Description of conclusion why transaction price was not best evidence of fair value</td> <td >The description of why the entity concluded that the transaction price was not the best evidence of fair value, including a description of the evidence that supports fair value.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 28 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DescriptionOfContractualAgreementOrStatedPolicyForChargingNetDefinedBenefitCost</td> <td >text</td> <td >Description of contractual agreement or stated policy for charging net defined benefit cost</td> <td >The description of the contractual agreement or stated policy for charging the net defined benefit cost, or the fact that there is no such policy, for an entity participating in defined benefit plans that share risks between various entities under common control. Expected volatility is a measure of the amount by which a price is expected to fluctuate during a period. A rate regulator is an authorised body that is empowered by statute or regulation to establish the rate or a range of rates that bind an entity. The rate regulator may be a third-party body or a related party of the entity, including the entityâ€™s own governing board, if that body is required by statute or regulation to set rates both in the interest of the customers and to ensure the overall financial viability of the entity.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 14 30 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DescriptionOfImpactOfRateRegulationOnCurrentAndDeferredTax</td> <td >text</td> <td >Description of impact of rate regulation on current and deferred tax</td> <td >The description of the impact of the rate regulation on the current and deferred tax. Rate regulation is a framework for establishing the prices that can be charged to customers for goods or services and that framework is subject to oversight and/or approval by a rate regulator.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 14 34</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DescriptionOfInformationAboutSurplusOrDeficitOfMultiemployerPlan</td> <td >text</td> <td >Description of information about surplus or deficit of multi-employer or state plan</td> <td >The description of available information about a surplus or deficit in a multi-employer or state plan that may affect the amount of future contributions. Inputs are the assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset, including assumptions about risk such as the risk inherent in a particular valuation technique used to measure fair value (such as a pricing model) and the risk inherent in the inputs to the valuation technique.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 13 93 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DescriptionOfInputsUsedInFairValueMeasurementEntitysOwnEquityInstruments</td> <td >text</td> <td >Description of inputs used in fair value measurement, entity's own equity instruments</td> <td >The description of inputs used in the fair value measurement of the entity's own equity instruments. An investment entity is an entity that: (a) obtains funds from one or more investors for the purpose of providing those investor(s) with investment management services; (b) commits to its investor(s) that its business purpose is to invest funds solely for returns from capital appreciation, investment income, or both; and (c) measures and evaluates the performance of substantially all of its investments on a fair value basis.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 12 Investment entity status</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DisclosureOfInvestmentPropertyAbstract</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td >Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [abstract]</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td ><IE></IE></td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DisclosureOfInvestmentPropertyExplanatory</td> <td >text block</td> <td >Disclosure of investment property [text block]</td> <td >The entire disclosure for investment property.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 40 Disclosure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DisclosureOfInvestmentPropertyLineItems</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td >Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [line items]</td> <td >Line items represent concepts included in a table. made only if such terms can be substantiated.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 24 23</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DisclosureWhetherLoansPayableInDefaultRemediedOrTermsOfLoansPayableRenegotiatedBeforeAuthorisationForIssueOfFinancialStatements</td> <td >text</td> <td >Explanation of whether default was remedied or terms of loans payable were renegotiated before financial statements were authorised for issue</td> <td >The explanation of whether a default on loans payable was remedied, or terms of the loans payable were renegotiated, before the financial statements were authorised for issue.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 18 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DiscontinuedOperationsMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Discontinued operations [member]</td> <td >This member stands for a component of an entity that either has been disposed of or is classified as held for sale, and that: (a) represents a separate major line of business or geographical area of operations; (b) is part of a single co-ordinated plan to dispose of a separate major line of business or geographical area of operations; or (c) is a subsidiary acquired exclusively with a view to resale. A component of an entity comprises operations and cash flows that can be clearly distinguished, operationally and for financial reporting purposes, from the rest of the entity. [Refer: Subsidiaries [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 5 Presentation and Disclosure</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DiscountedCashFlowMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Discounted cash flow [member]</td> <td >This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the income approach that involves analysing future cash flow amounts through the application of present value techniques and inputs (for example, weighted average cost of capital, long-term revenue growth rate, long-term pre-tax operating margin, discount for lack of marketability, control premium). [Refer: Income approach [member]; Weighted average [member]]</td> <td >example: IFRS 13 B11 a, example: IFRS 13 IE63</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DiscountedUnguaranteedResidualValueOfAssetsSubjectToFinanceLease</td> <td >X instant, debit</td> <td >Discounted unguaranteed residual value of assets subject to finance lease</td> <td >The amount of the discounted unguaranteed residual value of assets subject to finance leases. Unguaranteed residual value is the portion of the residual value of the underlying asset, the realisation of which by a lessor is not assured or is guaranteed solely by a party related to the lessor. Finance lease is a lease that transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 16 94</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DiscountRateMeasurementInputMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Discount rate, measurement input [member]</td> <td >This member stands for a discount rate used as a measurement input used in valuation techniques based on a present value calculation.</td> <td >common practice: IFRS 13 93 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DiscountRateUsedInCurrentMeasurementOfFairValueLessCostsOfDisposal</td> <td >X.XX instant</td> <td >Discount rate used in current measurement of fair value less costs of disposal</td> <td >The discount rate used in the current measurement of fair value less costs of disposal.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 36 130 f iii</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DiscountRateUsedInPreviousMeasurementOfFairValueLessCostsOfDisposal</td> <td >X.XX instant</td> <td >Discount rate used in previous measurement of fair value less costs of disposal</td> <td >The discount rate used in the previous measurement of fair value less costs of disposal.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 36 130 f iii</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DiscountRateUsedToReflectTimeValueOfMoneyRegulatoryDeferralAccountBalances</td> <td >X.XX instant</td> <td >Discount rate used to reflect time value of money, regulatory deferral account balances</td> <td >The discount rate used to reflect the time value of money that is applicable to regulatory deferral account balances. [Refer: Subsidiaries [member]]</td> <td >example: IAS 10 22 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >DisposalsAndRetirementsIntangibleAssetsAndGoodwill</td> <td >X duration, credit</td> <td >Disposals and retirements, intangible assets and goodwill</td> <td >The decrease in intangible assets and goodwill resulting from disposals and retirements. [Refer: Liabilities under insurance contracts and reinsurance contracts issued]</td> <td >example: IFRS 4 IG37 d - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE>, example: IFRS 4 37 e - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExpenseOfRestructuringActivities</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Expense of restructuring activities</td> <td >The amount of expense relating to restructuring. Restructuring is a programme that is planned and controlled by management and materially changes either the scope of a business undertaken by an entity or the manner in which that business is conducted. Such programmes include: (a) the sale or termination of a line of business; (b) closure of business locations in a country or region or the relocation of activities from one country or region to another; (c) changes in management structure; and (d) fundamental reorganisations that have a material effect on the nature and focus of the entity's operations.</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 1 98 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExpenseRecognisedDuringPeriodForBadAndDoubtfulDebtsForRelatedPartyTransaction</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Expense recognised during period for bad and doubtful debts for related party transaction</td> <td >The amount of expense recognised during the period in respect of bad or doubtful debts due from related parties. [Refer: Related parties [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IAS 24 18 d</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExpenseRelatingToLeasesOfLowvalueAssetsForWhichRecognitionExemptionHasBeenUsed</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Expense relating to leases of low-value assets for which recognition exemption has been used</td> <td >The amount of the expense relating to leases of low-value assets accounted for applying paragraph 6 of IFRS 16. This expense need not include the expense relating to leases with a lease term of one month or less. Short-term lease is a lease that, at the commencement date, has a lease term of 12 months or less. A lease that contains a purchase option is not a short-term lease.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 16 53 c</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExpenseRelatingToVariableLeasePaymentsNotIncludedInMeasurementOfLeaseLiabilities</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Expense relating to variable lease payments not included in measurement of lease liabilities</td> <td >The amount of the expense relating to variable lease payments not included in the measurement of lease liabilities. Variable lease payments are the portion of payments made by a lessee to a lessor for the right to use an underlying asset during the lease term that varies because of changes in facts or circumstances occurring after the commencement date, other than the passage of time. [Refer: Lease liabilities]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 16 53 e</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExpensesArisingFromReinsuranceHeld</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Expenses arising from reinsurance held</td> <td >The amount of expenses relating to reinsurance contracts held.</td> <td >example: IAS 1 85 - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE>, example: IFRS 4 IG24 d - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE>, example: IFRS 4 37 b - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExpensesFromAllocationOfPremiumsPaidToReinsurer</td> <td >X duration, debit</td> <td >Expenses from allocation of premiums paid to reinsurer</td> <td >The amount of expenses from an allocation of the premiums paid to the reinsurer. The incremental borrowing rate is the rate of interest that a lessee would have to pay to borrow over a similar term, and with a similar security, the funds necessary to obtain an asset of a similar value to the right-of-use asset in a similar economic environment.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 16 C12 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExplanationOfDirectMeasurementOfFairValueOfGoodsOrServicesReceived</td> <td >text</td> <td >Explanation of direct measurement of fair value of goods or services received</td> <td >The explanation of how the fair value of goods or services received was determined if it was measured directly (for example, whether fair value was measured at a market price for those goods or services).</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 2 48</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >ExplanationOfDisposalOfInvestmentPropertyCarriedAtCostOrInAccordanceWithIFRS16WithinFairValueModel</td> <td >text</td> <td >Explanation of disposal of investment property carried at cost or in accordance with IFRS 16 within fair value model</td> <td >The explanation of the fact that the entity has disposed of investment property not carried at fair value when the entity measures investment property at cost or in accordance with IFRS 16 within the fair value model, because fair value is not reliably determinable on a continuing basis. These adjustments may arise in such circumstances as: (a) the resolution of uncertainties that arise from the terms of the disposal transaction, such as the resolution of purchase price adjustments and indemnification issues with the purchaser; (b) the resolution of uncertainties that arise from and are directly related to the operations of the component before its disposal, such as environmental and product warranty obligations retained by the seller; and (c) the settlement of employee benefit plan obligations, provided that the settlement is directly related to the disposal transaction. For this purpose the entityâ€™s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entityâ€™s own equity instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Financial liabilities]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 25, disclosure: IFRS 7 35H, disclosure: IFRS 7 35I, disclosure: IFRS 7 35M, example: IFRS 7 35N</td> A financial asset shall be measured at fair value through profit or loss unless it is measured at amortised cost or at fair value through other comprehensive income. A gain (loss) on a financial asset measured at fair value shall be recognised in profit or loss unless it is part of a hedging relationship, it is an investment in an equity instrument for which the entity has elected to present gains and losses in other comprehensive income or it is a financial asset measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: At fair value [member]; Financial assets]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 8 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossAbstract</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td >Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss [abstract]</td> <td ><IE></IE></td> <td ><IE></IE></td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossCategoryMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, category [member]</td> <td >This member stands for the financial assets at fair value through profit or loss category. A financial asset is classified as held for trading if: (a) it is acquired principally for the purpose of selling it in the near term; (b) on initial recognition it is part of a portfolio of identified financial instruments that are managed together and for which there is evidence of a recent actual pattern of short-term profit-taking; or (c) it is a derivative (except for a derivative that is a financial guarantee contract or a designated and effective hedging instrument). [Refer: At fair value [member]; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss]</td> <td >common practice: IAS 1 55, disclosure: IFRS 7 8 a - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossClassifiedAsHeldForTradingCategoryMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, classified as held for trading, category [member]</td> <td >This member stands for the financial assets at fair value through profit or loss classified as held for trading category. A financial asset shall be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income if both of the following conditions are met: (a) the financial asset is held within a business model whose objective is achieved by both collecting contractual cash flows and selling financial assets and (b) the contractual terms of the financial asset give rise on specified dates to cash flows that are solely payments of principal and interest on the principal amount outstanding. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 30 e - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >FinancialLiabilities</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Financial liabilities</td> <td >The amount of liabilities that are: (a) a contractual obligation: (i) to deliver cash or another financial asset to another entity; or (ii) to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another entity under conditions that are potentially unfavourable to the entity; or (b) a contract that will, or may be, settled in the entityâ€™s own equity instruments and is: (i) a non-derivative for which the entity is, or may be, obliged to deliver a variable number of the entityâ€™s own equity instruments; or (ii) a derivative that will, or may be, settled other than by the exchange of a fixed amount of cash or another financial asset for a fixed number of the entityâ€™s own equity instruments. For this purpose, rights, options or warrants to acquire a fixed number of the entityâ€™s own equity instruments for a fixed amount of any currency are equity instruments if the entity offers the rights, options or warrants pro rata to all of its existing owners of the same class of its own non-derivative equity instruments. Also, for those purposes the entityâ€™s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments that are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entityâ€™s own equity instruments. As an exception, an instrument that meets the definition of a financial liability is classified as an equity instrument if it has all the features and meets the conditions in paragraphs 16A-16B or paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Financial assets; Derivatives [member]]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 25</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >FinancialLiabilitiesAffectedByAmendmentsToIFRS9ForPrepaymentFeaturesWithNegativeCompensationCarryingAmountAfterApplyingAmendments</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Financial liabilities affected by amendments to IFRS 9 for prepayment features with negative compensation, carrying amount after applying amendments</td> <td >The carrying amount of financial liabilities affected by the amendments to IFRS 9 for prepayment features with negative compensation, after applying the amendments.</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 9 7.2.34 b</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td 7.2.34 a</td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >FinancialLiabilitiesAtAmortisedCost</td> <td >X instant, credit</td> <td >Financial liabilities at amortised cost</td> <td >The amount of financial liabilities at amortised cost. The amortised cost is the amount at which financial liabilities are measured at initial recognition minus principal repayments, plus or minus the cumulative amortisation using the effective interest method of any difference between that initial amount and the maturity amount. [Refer: Financial liabilities]</td> <td >disclosure: IFRS 7 8 g, disclosure: IFRS 7 8 f - Expiry date <DATE ISO="20210101">2021-01-01</DATE> </td> </tr> <tr> <td >ifrs-full</td> <td >FinancialLiabilitiesAtAmortisedCostCategoryMember</td> <td >member</td> <td >Financial liabilities at amortised cost, category [member]</td> <td >This member stands for the financial liabilities at amortised cost category.
